title: Too frightened to urinate in public? You're not alone
text:
Chris Stokel-Walker meets (the mostly male) sufferers of paruresis, shy bladder syndrome, and hears of efforts to bring the social phobia out in the open

When Andrew Smith was a young man, he used to have to plan out every move he made during the day so he wasn’t caught needing to pee while out of his home. When he was in public, a constant fear would tick over in the back of his mind: the risk that he’d need to use a public bathroom, and that he’d have to pee in a urinal – and wouldn’t be able to.

“I’ve had a shy bladder all my life,” the 73-year-old chair of the UK Paruresis Trust explains. Paruresis is the medical term for shy bladder syndrome – a paralysing fear of peeing publicly that...
